message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper deals with generative document models that focus on semantic content while partially forego syntactic information. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category of Computer Science, which is cs.CL. Additionally, the paper proposes an extension to the Neural Variational Document Model, which is a machine learning model, indicating that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also uses a variational autoencoder framework, which is a type of deep learning model, suggesting that it could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper deals with next-word prediction, which is a common task in neural language models, indicating that it could also belong to the Neural Networks (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions experiments involving robustness to syntactic noise, which could suggest that it belongs to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category, as this is a common issue in image processing.
